page.title: 16A GAMEKEEPER-HOUGHTON ESTATE
page.content: Although now a contracting industry on this estate, game shooting is still important.The estate employs 2 keepers and provides enough gamebirds for 8-1O guns (each paying Â£1OOO per annum)at 9 shoots a year.Each shoot takes roughly 15O brace, most of the bag is sold to a local game-dealer to help offset the enormous cost of rearing, feeding and protecting the birds.The keeper buys day old partridge and pheasant chicks to rear under gas lamps, gradually they are moved to outside pens and finally released but still fed regularly. A vital part of the keepers job is to protect the game from vermin and poachers.Fox ,stoat, weasels,grey squirrel & magpies all prey on gamebirds.Although he liases with neighbouring keepers,his is a solitary life spending long hours listening and watching, alert to the signs of nature
